newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan raises defence spending two pct in '97/98.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan raises defence spending two pct in '97/98.

text.p: Pakistan allocated 134 billion rupees for defence out of total expenditure of 552 billion rupees in its budget for fiscal 1997/98 (July-June) on Friday.

The defence spending allocation was two percent higher than the 131.4 billion rupees allocated in 1996/97, but represented a decrease in real terms, given inflation running at 12.93 percent year-on-year in May.

The total budget outlay of 552 billion rupees represented an increase of 10.4 percent over the 1996/97 budget of 500.2 billion rupees, according to budget figures released by the official news agency APP.
